subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han compound|口|夨|ls=ic|t1=mouth|t2=man with tilted head}} – to speak loudly.

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text: Perhaps related to {{cog|bo|ངར་སྐད||roar; shout}}, {{cog|bo|ང་རོ||roar; yell; shout}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).

subSections.title: Definitions
Compounds
subSections.text: {{zh-der|吳鳳|吳都|吳淞江|吳國|吳鉤|吹簫吳市|吳鹽|吳剛|吳語|吳派|吳宮教陣|吳牛喘月|吳剛伐桂|大吳|伐東吳|吳越春秋|吳郭魚|吳下阿蒙|吳越同舟|句吳|宋畫吳冶|吳子|吳茱萸|吳頭楚尾|吳越|吳市吹簫|吳儂|孫吳|楚尾吳頭|東吳|吳川|吳堡|吳山|吳店|吳榜|吳棚|吳樓|吳灣|吳家灣|吳鋪}}

subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanji|grade=|rs=口04}} <!-- Not a kyūjitai character of 呉 -->

# {{defn|lang=ja|sort=口04}}

subSections.title: Readings
subSections.text:
* {{ja-readings|on=[[ご]] (go)|kun=[[くれ]] (kure), [[くれる]] (kureru)}}

1) Pronunciations of Kanji from before the 7th / 8th centuries. Possibly from the Korean peninsula or southern China. Often used in Buddhist texts.

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: This character lacks JIS support. The character [[呉]] (U+5449) is used instead in Japanese.
